HISTORY OF PRESENT ILLNESS : Mr. Blind is a 79-year-old white white male with a history of diabetes mellitus , inferior myocardial infarction , who underwent open repair of his increased diverticulum November 13th at Sephsandpot Center . The patient developed hematemesis November 15th and was intubated for respiratory distress . He was transferred to the Valtawnprinceel Community Memorial Hospital for endoscopy and esophagoscopy on the 16th of November which showed a 2 cm linear tear of the esophagus at 30 to 32 cm . The patient 's hematocrit was stable and he was given no further intervention . On the morning of the 22nd the patient developed tachypnea with a chest X-ray showing a question of congestive heart failure . A medical consult was obtained at the Valtawnprinceel Community Memorial Hospital . The patient was given intravenous Lasix . A arterial blood gases on 100 percent face mask showed an oxygen of 205 , CO2 57 and PH 7.3 . An electrocardiogram showed ST depressions in V2 through V4 which improved with sublingual and intravenous nitroglycerin . The patient was transferred to the Coronary Care Unit for management of his congestive heart failure , ischemia and probable aspiration pneumonia . The patient 's past medical history is significant for : 2. non insulin dependent diabetes mellitus , 3. history of colitis . The patient 's medications at home were Micronase , Isordil and aspirin . The patient 's social history is remarkable for greater than 80 pack years of smoking , which he discontinued 15 years prior to admission . He is a former alcoholic , but without any alcohol in 30 years prior to admission . He is a retired welder . He is legally blind . PHYSICAL EXAMINATION : On physical examination he is a tachypneic white male on 40 percent face mask with oxygen saturations 98 percent . He was afebrile . Blood pressure 150/60 , heart rate 90 's , respirations 22 . He had no gag . His fundus was poorly seen . He did count fingers in both eyes at one foot . He had 2+ carotids on time without bruits . The jugular venous pressure was 6 . His heart rate was regular rate and rhythm . His abdomen was benign . His neurological examination was remarkable for a mildly encephalopathic male . He was oriented times two . Four liter arterial blood gas of 71/43/7.45 , ionized calcium 1.03 , normal electrolytes , BUN and creatinine 16/1.4 , glucose 246 , calc , mag and phos normal , albumin 2.2 , LDH 227 , liver function tests normal , white count 10.6 , hematocrit 32 which was 31 on the 19th and 38 on the 16th , prothrombin time 9.9 , partial thromboplastin time 26 . A sputum gram stain showed moderate polys with few gram negative rods . An electrocardiogram on admission to the CCU showed normal sinus , 90 beats per minute , with a normal axis , normal intervals , an old inferior myocardial infarction and up sloping ST depressions with V2 to V4 with increased rate . The patient was admitted to the Coronary Care Unit and placed on Unasyn for a question of aspiration pneumonia . He was also placed on intravenous nitroglycerin , oxygen and aspirin for his coronary ischemia . The patient remained stable in the Coronary Care Unit and was transferred to the floor on the 23rd on aspirin , Carafate , intravenous Haldol , nebs , Unasyn , NPH with CZI sliding coverage , morphine , Compazine and intravenous Benadryl . His blood gas at that time on 40 percent face mask was 84 , 42 , 7.48 . He was taken for esophagogastroduodenoscopy by the Surgical Service after elective intubation for airway control . The clot was dense despite multiple attempts at lavage . He was readmitted to the Coronary Care Unit on the 25th , where initially he was stable . His aspirin was discontinued . He was continued on the intravenous Cimetidine and Carafate except that he was made NPO . He was transfused to keep hematocrit greater than 30 . On the 25th he developed progressive hypotension with evidence of further upper gastrointestinal bleeding . He was intubated for airway protection . Repeat endoscopy was unsuccessful because of severe bleeding despite massive lavage . A pneumothorax was noted on his chest X-ray on the 25th and a chest tube was placed . On the 26th , because of continued massive bleeding , he was taken by Vascular Radiology for a question of embolization . No varices were noted . He was continued to be intubated with poor mental status . He was paralyzed for the vascular procedure . A head computerized tomography scan on the 26th showed a probable right cerebellar infarct and a question of a right middle cerebral artery infarct . Given the multi organ system failure on the 26th the family was consulted regarding his dismal prognosis and they decided to make the patient do not resuscitate without further pressures or aggressive measures with comfort care being paramount . The patient continued to have bleeding with progressive downward deterioration of his mental status and renal failure and temperature spikes . The patient died on the 31st .
